website_summaries.verdict: Full-length style of carport canopy that makes it work great for both gatherings and to protect your vehicle.
pros: Sides of canopy stretch to the ground, which helps the unit stand up better to windy conditions than some shorter canopies
Six metal leg poles give you a nice level of stability in the carport
Material in the canopy is able to block the dangerous UV rays from the sun, but it still allows some natural light inside the enclosure
cons: Will not hold up well to the weight of snow
Priced a little higher than some other options

customer_reviews.title: This is the cheapest product I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this in December and just put it up tonight. While pulling on the side panels to velcro them together the material ripped. The roof frame poles are the thinnest pot metal type of stuff you can think of. Where the 2 poles connect the metal broke from maybe 5 mph winds within a half hour of putting it up. This is literally the worst product I've ever purchased thru Amazon . Not to mention the pole that broke cut my left thumb so I am typing with 2 index fingers right now. Please please please do not buy this. Go to Costco
customer_reviews.author: James mcclain

customer_reviews.title: I love the space it creates
customer_reviews.text: I admit that when I received it the box was a mess. I was prepared for missing parts and began to photograph everything carefully. However within an hour and a half my daughter had the tent up. We understood the directions well. We used it for a garage sale and slept outside with our stuff. It was windy the first night and the material was loud in the wind. The next night I hung some light cloth from the poles and the sound was much quieter. My son borrowed it for his son's birthday party this weekend. I don't think I can leave it up permanently in the backyard, but I wish I could. I love the space it creates.
customer_reviews.author: grapelily

customer_reviews.title: The covers are even worst. Tears easily
customer_reviews.text: This is nothing but a cheap imitation of what a tent suppose to be. It's very feeble. Bends under the slightest pressure of wind. Too much parts to piece together. This tent didn't even last me a week. The covers are even worst. Tears easily. By far my most regrettable buy on Amazon. Be warned! Don't buy. Even with weights it made no sense. The anchors were terrible.
customer_reviews.author: robert b

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, cheap thin tubing, not as described, do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D H

customer_reviews.title: Decent and cheap but tricky putting the ceiling tarp on to keep the whole thing from falling apart.
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend having good ground stakes for this. Took 3 people and a ladder less than a half hour to set up but it's definitely on the cheap side and be prepared for some aggravation. The locking mechanism on the pipes don't lock very well. Until you have the ceiling tarp very tight on the frame to keep it together, it's going to fall apart easily. Getting the tarp on without it falling apart is the tough part. The side panels are easy to put up and useful.
customer_reviews.author: N. Sodaro

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased 2 tents to use for an anniversary party and they were wonderful. We didn't have to use additional tape or weights to hold the tent down, but I don't think it would hurt to add the additional support. The tents withstood light winds and provided a really nice look...lots of compliments were given.
customer_reviews.author: Ebone'

customer_reviews.title: This is not a rental quality tent, but look at the price, that's not what you should expect.
customer_reviews.text: This tent works great on my deck to offer shade, or protection from a gentle rain. Other reviewers recommended using white duct tape on all of the joints, the manufacturer listened and there was a roll included with my tent. Use it. I've had it up for 2 parties so far and it's still going strong. If it rains you will have to go around and knock the puddles off, and if there is ANY wind you have to tie it down. DO NOT expect a rental quality tent for this price, but it works fine for occasional personal use.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Davis

customer_reviews.title: had to make due under deadline the tents looked nice once assembled if you ignored the rips
customer_reviews.text: bought 2 tents, opened the boxes and removed tent sides. in both boxes found several section with cuts in the material. had to make due under deadline the tents looked nice once assembled if you ignored the rips. and some areas dis rip more with just being assembled will not purchase these tents again would like to return but dont have original boxes and folding the sides ans top back up. never get it back into a box.
customer_reviews.author: Carmean

customer_reviews.title: Great for occasional use.
customer_reviews.text: Loved this but... We used it for three events and then at the end of the season it was a bit rainy and windy. Unfortunately, the tent doesn’t stand up to Midwest onset weather. A couple of the bars snapped and bent in a light storm. We were so disappointed as we loved this tent but the quality of the bars wasn’t strong enough on top. The tent did anchor well and stay standing - just the top gave out and bent. The canvas mesh is top quality and great! If you are only using a few times a year in sunny conditions it would be perfect as you can adjust the sides. Just wish they replaced faulty bars.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Ordaz

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Think I could have used sticks and twine and had a more stable structure. A lot of the poles was bent on the ends and wouldn’t fit together. The plastic union pieces was not molded properly so the poles didn’t fit together and the clips wouldn’t clip. The tarp cover was not fitted what so ever. Almost came apart trying to cover the structure. Don’t be fooled by the misleading script of how the poles are thicker. They may be but not thick enough. Only had it together for ten minutes before I made the decision to take it down. Didn’t want it to fall on our guests in the very minimal breeze we had that afternoon.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: During our preparation for a party, a heavy thundershower with strong winds damaged two poles of our Quictent 10'x20' Party Tent. We were able to make a temporary repair with tape and the tent easily kept us dry for the remainder of the evening. After disassembly, I contacted QuicTent customer service about purchasing replacement parts. They responded quickly and even offered to send replacement parts at no cost and cover shipping. The needed parts were received within a week. We plan to use our tent for years to come and would absolutely purchase another. Despite other reviews indicating difficulty in assembly, we did not find it to be a significant challenge. Assembly time was about 45 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W Scheffer

customer_reviews.title: CRAP! Stay away from this tent.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is crap! Stay away. We bought it for our camp site and head out up for less than 24hrs. Needless to say, one small wind (not gusty at all, can in and the poles broke! It stayed standing but one of the poles broke and a corner tired because the tarp is thinner than a reusable grocery bag. Get a better tent. You've been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Daddycracker

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Great and easy setup, was going to anchor the tent to the ground but stong gust of wind flipped it. And that was that, bent/broke 3 pipes can no longer be used as a 10x20 maybe a 10x10? Probably would not recommend if not immediately anchored. Or set in a zero wind environment.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad Z.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, VERY FLIMSY AND WEAK
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these, when we put the first one up, the next day it blew down and scratched up our vehicles. They came apart. The bars can bend very easily, they are not durable. If you blew at the thing it might blow away that's how cheap it is. I complained to the supplier and they only refunded me for one item. They are both broken and cannot be reused. It looked nice for the few hours we had it up. Never again. The supplier should be ashamed of themselves for selling this quality of merchandise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent customer service. Had trouble with tent parts arriving bent in the original package but they responded right away, and sent replacements immediately. When we had an issue with one of the tents coming apart due to what I believe were faulty parts, they again responded promptly and sent us replacement parts right away. They were polite, very helpful, and went out of their way to make sure you were happy with their service and product. The tents themselves were decent quality, very easy to assemble/disassemble and held up well on a non-windy day. Strongly recommend using the tape provided on the seams (like the other reviewers suggested) as well as weights. 5 stars for their wonderful customer service!
customer_reviews.author: TKO

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This tent was amazing. Put it up in less than a hour and took it down same day. Cheaper than renting a tent of the same size from a party store. The quality was good and the tent was sturdy. Everyone at my party was amazed by the quality of the tent for the price. We only duct taped the standing/leg poles and bought the water jug bases for the tent to keep it sturdy. Definitely recommend this product for those who intend to take it down the same day! We purchased the 10x20.
customer_reviews.author: A P T

customer_reviews.title: Only get it if you are planning on a one time use
customer_reviews.text: It is pretty low quality. The poles are made with metal but the the connecting pieces are cheap plastic and most of them broke the first day we used it. It was a pretty windy day an this tent does not do well with that at all. We filled 5 gallon buckets with rocks to hold it down which helped keep it from moving, but the top started pulling off. Also it is best to have a ladder there for setting it up because the top is out of reach from the ground and it makes it a lot easier to put the top cross bar in and pull the top plastic panel over.
customer_reviews.author: Salvatore Natale

customer_reviews.title: Great price, OK quality
customer_reviews.text: I set the tent up in windy conditions, which the manufacturer advises against, and it broke immediately. Their customer service sent a complete replacement tent for free. It's 100% necessary to make sure it isn't windy at all when you use it and also pick up some sandbags for the poles. Also, set it up before to make sure the correct pieces are there there was a mislabeled/wrong cross bar that was needed for the center bar along the canopy. Don't expect it to last particularly long though.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Great for the occasional event
customer_reviews.text: This tent will fill your needs for a outdoor event. I had setup the previous day and took down the day after the party. This is by no means a leave up for weeks type of tent. It works well in fair weather conditions. The poles are lightweight and could bend easily if not handled properly. Dont expect it to stand up to a good thubderstorm. For the cost of this product it should do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Lost Boy

customer_reviews.title: Tent was sent missing one corner "joint" Im pretty sure I messaged the seller about it but I ...
customer_reviews.text: Tent was sent missing one corner "joint" Im pretty sure I messaged the seller about it but I never heard anything back. We had to tape the corner to make it stand. We started off with 3 people putting it up and ended up enlisting 2 neighbors to help. If you read this, WE NEED A CORNER PIECE IN ORDER TO USE AGAIN WITHOUT A GAGGLE OF TAPE!
customer_reviews.author: B.Drayton

customer_reviews.title: Works great. It helps to have 2 people to put ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. It helps to have 2 people to put it together. It's a bunch of poles that snap together. It is pretty strong but every once in a while a pole will bend. For the price you can't beat it. It costs double to rent one this size around here. I have used it twice over the past year and I am very happy I bought it. I would suggest getting a duffel bag that would hold all the poles as the cardboard box does not hold up over time.
customer_reviews.author: Badsteak

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: It's a great product however it comes in a thousand pieces, some pieces were hard to click together when putting it together. Bringing it apart may wanna make you use it once. But it did the job and kept the rain and sun away
customer_reviews.author: Janell Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: too flimsy
customer_reviews.text: not terribly hard to assemble....need two people for sure. Set it up for party. Anchored it down firmly with weights. The very next morning it was half in our yard and half in the neighbors and a number of the rods were bent and two of them split should make with thicker, stronger metal and charge more. As is too flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: matthew  a. Ferris

customer_reviews.title: Slightly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed. The front tarp had four slits in it (like it had been cut with a box cutter). It leaked when it rained. I thought this would be as sturdy as my old 10x20 tent. The instructions were missing. This was sold by a third party; however, we did contact Quictent (maker of this tent) directly to get a copy of the instructions and their customer service was excellent. After providing them with the order number from Amazon, they emailed the instructions to us within the same day.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Quality was not what was expected
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the fact that the clips did not fit the holes and they did not lock strong enough. I had to use self tapping screws on all of the joints to make it sturdy as it came apart without them. Had to use tent stakes as the pins are not sturdy enough. Not very confident that this tent will hold up for the event we are having this coming weekend. Hope I am wrong. On a positive note the instructions were well written just not confident about the product.
customer_reviews.author: paul sanchez

customer_reviews.title: so setting it up isn't as easy as everyone makes it seem
customer_reviews.text: The only thing not 5-star is that this isn't a pop up, so setting it up isn't as easy as everyone makes it seem. Give yourself an additional 45 minutes to set up the frame (with one or two people) and you will be fine. Once set up, it looks professional, and we did a great job. We utilized the legs in a straight up and down position, so lost a couple of feet of space. Next time, we will set it up with the legs slanted to see if we get the full 20 feet advertised. Pleased with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely use tape to reinforce.
customer_reviews.text: Just used it this past Saturday for my daughter's graduation party. We had some help putting it together because it is not a 2 person job. I read reviews and used the white.duct tape to reinforce the tent like it was suggested. We also used ankle weights to weigh it down along with the spikes. It was a very windy day and we thought it was going to fly away but it didnt. It held nicely.
customer_reviews.author: laura anderson

customer_reviews.title: Looks great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a day party. Took 2-3 people to install. Installation took a good hour. Looks real nice once it was up. I love the options of putting up the side. We added lights since there were options for that. Can’t really complain for the price. I would not attempt to keep it up in a bad rain storm or windy night. Great for shielding against the sun or moderate rain.
customer_reviews.author: BJ

customer_reviews.title: Hefty bag with sticks.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that everything was numbered and labeled. Unfortunately the material is flimsy and cheap. The metal bars were cut wrong and we couldn't shove one into the other. Say piece 3 into 4 didn't interlock. The rods easily bent. The tarp had a lot of missing sewing parts holes in places, tape had to be used in multiple areas. The quality was not as expected even for price I expected something a little better.
customer_reviews.author: yesenia

customer_reviews.title: Very cheap and sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Went together easy, very thin canopy. We tied it down as instructions read, slightly windy day, we did do have any side walls up so breeze could flow through. Canopy ripped, poles bent....you guessed it! Single use purchase and I purchased 2 of them! Might as well pitched over $200 in the trash. Not recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Susie A.

customer_reviews.title: It served it’s purpose.
customer_reviews.text: It serves its purpose. I bought this for my kid’s bday party and it held up well until I left it out the next day when it was windy and a few of the tubes bent. The tubes are really flimsy and the tarp material int very good, but for the price it’s worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Quiroga

customer_reviews.title: Great party tent for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble (duct tape all frame connections). Had one incorrect pole which forced an emergency modification to complete set up. One side panel was missing a velcro strap which was no big deal. Decent quality if set up correctly and staked down properly. Left it up for a week and packed it away for the next party!
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for the price, not going to stand up to bad weather
customer_reviews.text: I bought to use for backyard parties with a little rain. Unfortunately a really big storm hit and blew it over, and over again. I think it’s salvagable, but will need some work to straighten and reinforce the poles. I do recommend it though for general use, it’s a nice tent.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: Needs modifications to connect.
customer_reviews.text: For the price it's a good buy but I wouldn't leave this up in any sort of strong wind. We had to notch out the plastic top connectors to get the clips to snap which was a little bit of a pain. And one of the straps broke during 1st install.
customer_reviews.author: DavidP

customer_reviews.title: Tent will not stand up to any wind.
customer_reviews.text: Used for grad party. Cheaply made. Seams tore in only a light wind the whole tent was bending. Material is a very cheap white tarp material that is very thin. Some poles not cut correctly where slits match with clip. Top supporting pole bent. Side pole shredded. Clips would not support side walls and tore off. Will have to toss tent. Very disappointed. If you have perfect weather with no wind it may work for you well.
customer_reviews.author: Tcee

customer_reviews.title: it accomplished what i was using it for but would ...
customer_reviews.text: it accomplished what i was using it for but would not buy if i was using it more then once. had to reinforce some of the roof poles that split at the notch for the locking clip to seat. doesn't take much wind to start tearing the velcro from the side panels. i did not spend a lot so i did not expect to much.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Sheahan

customer_reviews.title: Nope!!!! Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: This product is ok for a once or two time use. Cheaply made and the poles click together but are slotted poorly so you have to literally twist the poles until the metal and paint come off enough to clip into place. Cheap plastic corner pieces and the fabric is very cheap!! May use the frame buy some heavy mil plastic and make a green house in the spring. Otherwise this is useless. Cheap but still 100 bucks. Amazon needs to set some kind of product quality check but that wont happen. You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great price but omg so cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Great price but omg so cheaply made. Didn’t last the first windy day. Completely destroyed from a simple rain and windy summer night.
customer_reviews.author: BOBBY

customer_reviews.title: Easy even for the beginner
customer_reviews.text: Great product and easy to set up, definitly follow others recommendations with white tape, or do what I did and drill holes near the connectors and use white bungie cords to keep everything together. It makes it easier for removal when you take it down. Sturdy and great size for the price. Definite recomendation.
customer_reviews.author: Indie age art

customer_reviews.title: It's a good thing their warranty is so strong
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and flimsy. It's a good thing their warranty is so strong, because you'll need it. We used it for a single event and it's already got bent and broken poles. I'll be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: MisterSaturn

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a week ago and tried assembling, the parts on the tent didn’t line up to clip into place. That added to the already shaky frame. I’m going to return, after waste of time and money! You get what you pay for, you yourself a favor and spend the extra money! You’ll thank me later!
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty Roc

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tent!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent! We had so many compliments on it. We didn't use the sides so it was completely open for people sitting to see all the games going on at our Luau. Easy set up and take down. The only thing I would have loved, would be for it to have a case to hold it for storage. Didn't think to take a picture until the next day but it gibes a good idea of the size and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Lauffer

customer_reviews.title: Stake it down!
customer_reviews.text: This is a visually attractive tent, however the material is equivelent to a tarp from a hardware store in weight. In breezy conditions I would shy away from using this. Other than that it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Egregg57

customer_reviews.title: Fits great in the garbage can!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this tent! Had a light breeze and rain and it collapsed. Super light weight, the tabs for the strings to stake down rip off, the poles don’t stay together. Had it staked down with extra straps and it fell apart. Tried to work with seller, they said they’d replace the defective parts but won’t give a refund. “Defective” parts include the poles and the canopy which really aren’t defective, just really poor manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Odell

customer_reviews.title: Only good in nice weather.
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews and thought that I would be ok using stronger stakes and ratchet straps to hold it down... wrong. As long as there is no wind it's a nice tent any wind the poles break and the tarp rips.
customer_reviews.author: John Brodigan

customer_reviews.title: It works but missing parts
customer_reviews.text: It works and was fairly easy to set up but was missing one of the poles to make it complete! Was a bit disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Momedic

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these, both my boxes came in destroyed and most of the pipes were bent or crushed inside, I had to try and bent it back and some pipes would not lock in place and would slip out once it was assembled
customer_reviews.author: hernan

customer_reviews.title: Will definitely recommend!!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love!! These party tents are perfect! Can not beat the price. I bought these tents for an Easter party and had so many compliments! Had an issue with some of the poles, called customer service and OMG they are the greatest!! They were able to ship to me some new ones and were replaced right away for future parties. I will definitely be buying from Quictent again!!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: Not for windy conditions
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. Look good and very roomy. Had to anchor it very well though. I would not recommend for windy conditions as the side panels do a "parachute" effect and at the end the velcro ties almost ripped off. Other than that it is a good deal for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: So-so quality but worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Hard to put together, but so worth it! You need a team of 4 ppl- not exaggerating. The absolute best parts of this tent are the zippered entrance doors and panels as well as the white duct tape. The poles are pretty terrible quality tho, but what do you expect for only $100?
customer_reviews.author: H Family

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Their customer service is great. Tent has some issues with not being very strong or needing some stronger and longer stakes, which you can get at Home Depot. This is not a very strong tent but it will do the job if you don't have too much wind or if you buy longer/stronger stakes. It is a must that you have to use the ropes to tie it to the ground well. Whatever issues you might have, their customer service is very professional, so buy it with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Tani

customer_reviews.title: 10' x 20' Quictent
customer_reviews.text: The Quictent 10'x20' is a really good sized tent that I was able to install on my Deck. Excellent value for the cost I paid. The assembly is fairly easy. We installed the tent during an evening and that night there was a very sever thunder storm with extremely heavy winds. It caused some damage as we left the canopy on the tent which obviously created a great pressure. It bent some pipes and tore a few pipes. I contacted Quictent customer service and they were very helpful in getting us the replacement components at not cost. I would rate the product 4 star but the kind of customer service we got elevates my review to a 5!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these canopy’s for a graduation party. They were well packaged and we found the instructions easy to follow. Set up and tear down was quick. We have used them several times over the last couple of months and they have held up well. They will not withstand a storm but they aren’t meant to. We were very impressed with the seller, Brandline. We had a couple of small issues that they handled quickly and efficiently. These were a perfect alternative to renting an expensive tent.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bronwyn Craven

customer_reviews.title: Poles broke
customer_reviews.text: I liked that it was easy to assemble however it didn’t last very long. Once it was staked into place three of the cross poles cracked, the sides didn’t close all the way, when it rained it gathered on the roof. I had to use the white duct tape and other tape to fix the bars to make it last the rest of my garage sale.
customer_reviews.author: Keepsake13

customer_reviews.title: Best of the cheap canopies
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and relatively cheap. I had some issues with rain and wind. If you want something descent for the occasional event, this canopy is better than most. If you want something that can stand up for extended periods of time with little wind cover, you will have to find a better tent. In the end, I might get a couple more birthdays out of this tent. Money well spent. Tape every tube connection! It makes storage worse but you'll thank me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Huehn

customer_reviews.title: Good if you have the time/tools to make it good
customer_reviews.text: I’ll give this an honest review. Instructions were easy to follow and it’s not hard to set up with help. BUT. The clips to secure the pipes in place weren’t designed well and kept slipping out. You’d pull one side to clip it and the other side would fall out. If you don’t mind screwing the poles together or some other method of securing them together then you’re gonna be just fine. Materials are decent it’s just I had faulty clips on mine
customer_reviews.author: Bronson O.

customer_reviews.title: Great value for price!
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of this. It took a little while to put together but was easy to do if you are patient. Helpful to have at least one or two other people. Definitely use the sand bags —not sold separately. Left it up for a week!
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy as a jellyfish
customer_reviews.text: All the worst junk I've ever bought has been cheap Chinese crap from Amazon. This thing couldn't even manage to stand up under its own weight.
customer_reviews.author: O. Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice
customer_reviews.text: I only used once in nice weather and it did fine. Some the areas the stitching was undone and a strap come off. But it came with white duct tape which I use to shore up the weak areas.
customer_reviews.author: kelly keelty

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: While I wouldn't use this as a permanent solution, or a very big important function, it works great as a quick pop-up tent for random parties. I was able to assemble/take down myself without help, but having a second person is a plus. Some poles/connectors had trouble connecting without some extra force or modification.
customer_reviews.author: Edward James Hartman III

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy, lasted a couple of hours before the tent started to slant. Don’t waste your money on this, spend the extra $80 and buy the pop-up tent which is more sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: LisaSoSweet

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a not windy day
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my daughter's graduation party, but we have a very calm day with very little breeze. This tent is a huge kite, so any wind will whip it around and probably twist the pipes. The canopy is lower quality, so I did tape all the joints, but it made it thru one party and is reboxed for future needs.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: We have moved and used this for storage in our yard until we can finish downsizing. it has worked great and is still standing even though high winds sent it sailing. I only gave it four stars as the the corners need more fabric and the stakes are not too good and could have longer or stronger stakes, the ties for the rope need to be big and stronger as they ripped before the wind blew it away.
customer_reviews.author: highaltitude

customer_reviews.title: Works well if taken care of and secured properly.
customer_reviews.text: Need a min of 2 to set up. Need to tie down with weights (i used 5 gallon paint buckets fulled with water). Poles are thin so if you toss around or don't secure properly (each leg) they will get damaged. But it worked great, held up to wind and rain very well.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Way

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy materials used in construction
customer_reviews.text: Used once on a nice day for shade & poles show signs of weakness/wear beyond that of one use. The material used for the poles is very thin & flimsy. It will never last if used even 1-3 times more. I knew it was “economy” priced but it should still be built to last a couple of years - not a single season. I plan to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and useless
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product! Cheap connectors and poles that don’t lock when assembled. Don’t waste your time and money. Seller has no sense as to quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Ornelas3

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Well. the top tore while putting up and a pole bent, Mind you I put these up all the time. Just needed a quick one to add to the other two. I don't have time to return it. Taped up and added a hose clamp to the pole. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: The Grinch Family

customer_reviews.title: I am happy that these were not too expensive
customer_reviews.text: I am happy that these were not too expensive. We bought 2 of them, and put them up over our pool area. They broke and tore pretty quickly. We have high winds in our area, and they did not stand up to them at all. Had I known that before I would not have bought them.
customer_reviews.author: Cherish

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Putting it together wasn’t so hard, it just wouldn’t stay together. My dad had to tie a lot of it together so it would stay. The bars kept coming out of place. We would fix one, only for another to pop out. It was fine once we tied together but it’s not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Evy

customer_reviews.title: Durable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two and couldn’t be happier. Easy to assemble and disassemble. And let me tell you... it’s durable!! Got it for an outdoor party, ended up not only raining but down pouring all night. Our friends hung out under it all night and didn’t get us wet or blow away. Ended up leaving them up for about a month with continued rain and they never had an issue. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quictent 10'x20' Party Tent Gazebo Wedding Canopy with Removable Sidewalls & Elegant Church
customer_reviews.text: Gave away as a gift. They said it takes several people to get set up. Seems to be made well. For the money its a very good bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Cash

customer_reviews.title: Great value for price
customer_reviews.text: Great product for price. First canopy had a small hole & rips in it, but the company was great about sending a new one. 2nd one was awesome. Easy to put together, we reinforced poles with tape & bought small disc weights for the legs. Held up at 2 parties on windy days. Definitely worth the money over renting a tent.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking! Don’t buy!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to assemble but it makes it hard when the materials are cheap. Plastic connectors hooking on to cheap metal pipes. The connectors aren’t all cut like their supposed to be so I had to fix them. They include duct tape which says a lot. Have to used that tape every time I set up the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Serena

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for whatever you need it for!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good tent for your outdoor activities. We used this for our church’s annual turkey shoot and it worked great! We did have an incident with a storm that moved in and picked up the tent and blew it down the hill where we had it set up. This did damage the entire tent and it was our first time using it, but the company has a great replacement policy. Getting us the replacement parts was easy and quick!
customer_reviews.author: James Choate

customer_reviews.title: Really cheap
customer_reviews.text: Super flimsy we would have had to set up the day of the event just to have it hold long enough instead of the day before
customer_reviews.author: Jp

customer_reviews.title: but over all we where dry and had a great party.
customer_reviews.text: I needed it for a one time use and it servid its purpose . However it is very flimsy and cheaply made . for an example there where already a couple of small holes in the tarp. The polls that holk it up keep on unclicking from each other and when we pulled the ceiling taught one of the parrs bent, but over all we where dry and had a great party.
customer_reviews.author: Jake B.

customer_reviews.title: Works but don’t expect it to last long
customer_reviews.text: It took a little longer than expected to put it up. I’d recommend another tent that’s easier to put up and take down. The poles were flimsy and it lasted 3 days for us. The wind knocked it down and bent the poles so basically worthless now. We ended up buying a different brand and throwing this to the side of our barn. Maybe we’ll fix it someday
customer_reviews.author: Hoa Tran

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent and customer service
customer_reviews.text: We used our tent on a fairly windy day. We purchased the sand bags from Amazon as well and it kept the tent grounded. We received many compliments on the tent and it served its purpose well. Customer service is also fantastic. I contacted them for a few replacement parts and within days they were shipped. I highly recommend this product and company.
customer_reviews.author: J. Walters

customer_reviews.title: Great tents for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Purcahsed 2x 10x20' tents for a birthday party. They looked great, received a lot of complements from guests. I strongly recommend setting everything up maybe 2 days before your event since some of the items come damaged (poles, zippers, clips). Even though things were damaged, they were easily fixed and it didn't affect the performance of the tenets. Recommend buying some type of weights or good stakes for the legs as they are pretty light. Also add screws to the legs or use the included white duct tape, trust me on that. For the price it's a great bargain, makes everything I mentioned worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesus Estrada

customer_reviews.title: Instructions are very easy to follow and set-up can be accomplished in 30 ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product for family use (grad parties, family gatherings, etc.). The product was delivered on time and packaged very well. Instructions are very easy to follow and set-up can be accomplished in 30 minutes after going through the process for the first time. The tent held up well during a heavy rain storm. On our second use we got caught off guard with a bad storm with high winds. The tent sustained some wind damage. We contacted Quictent via email and explained the situation. They were quick to respond and easy to work with, providing replacement parts at no cost.
customer_reviews.author: Loren Strife

customer_reviews.title: Great party tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great party tent for the price, however some of the poles were bent out of shape when delivered, and i had to trim some of the plastic connectors because they wouldn't clip in right.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Abeyta

customer_reviews.title: This worked very well for my wedding
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent for a great price! It stood up sturdy for us. My only complaint that there was not a decent carrying case and there was NO WAY we could fit it back in th box it came in.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Amrine

customer_reviews.title: Canopy success
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping easy to assemble helps to have a couple extra hands to speed up and with sides being separate makes this very versatile. Frame is a little flimsy need to use tie downs and anchor all corners
customer_reviews.author: chuck johnson

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply built.
customer_reviews.text: This was very poorly designed. The poles did not align correctly. They kept coming apart. It too 4 people and a lot of tape to put it together. The only positive point, it did keep us dry when it rained. Overall, extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: mirstnkim

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Durable and easy to setup. Have used it many times. Many of the people at my party have remarked at how nice the tent is for parties and have wanted to borrow it. The actual covering is very durable too.
customer_reviews.author: Penny T

customer_reviews.title: One time use
customer_reviews.text: Very hard to put together, took several hours and 2 people. Cheaper than renting.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy Reyes

customer_reviews.title: I liked it. I say don't leave it up overnight ...
customer_reviews.text: I liked it. I say don't leave it up overnight if your trying to get a lot of uses out of it. I guess we had a windy night after we used it and it blew it over and tossed the weights around. I did get a use out of it for my event though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good product for the price you pay
customer_reviews.text: Very good product for the price you pay. Needs definitely two person to set it up and. It takes around 1-2 hours to set up for the first time. The material is kinda cheap but worked for my party. Worth to buy.
customer_reviews.author: nazanin

customer_reviews.title: connector pieces/metal bars aren't as strong as I would like but think it work as expected and designed
customer_reviews.text: set up but haven't used yet for the event. connector pieces/metal bars aren't as strong as I would like but think it work as expected and designed.
customer_reviews.author: Kandy Wright

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Party Tent
customer_reviews.text: The tent sets up reasonably easy with two people, just follow the directions closely. I used the tent for a weekend party. All the quests loved it. Make sure you anchor the tent securely, otherwise an occasional wind gusts will give you problems. I used the sand bag anchors which worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: Went together quite easily, but after a 20 mph wind
customer_reviews.text: Went together quite easily, but after a 20 mph wind, it came totally apart. Framework is not tough enough. We had cross ties, and it was staked down with 12" heavy duty stakes. Would not recommend if you are where the wind might blow.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis M.

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy at all.  Terrible product.
customer_reviews.text: This item was not sturdy at all. The legs did not stay in the leg anchors and the stakes were very weak and easy to bend. A small gust of wind caused the sides to fly and flap. I am not happy with this purchase at all. Also the canopy and sides were dirty. How is this possible for a supposedly BRAND NEW product. Such a disappointment!! Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: But this one!
customer_reviews.text: ETA was from 3/22-3/26 I ordered it on 18th and was worried it come after the 23rd (party day)but took a risk and so happy it got here in the 22nd. Easy to set up, me and my teens set it up and good material for the price. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: eunice

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for outdoor events
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for outdoor events. Not a lasting structure did have to tie it down a little more than intended in the instructions. Get some white duct in case the pieces break. Great product for the money. I used it 3 times
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn Mullins

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: not at all what i expected the poles keep popping out of the plastic fittings and the canopy top doesn't stretch enough to fit..... Its garbage.... like a one time use the top is already ripping at the seams and i just set it up for the first time....
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Much better than I thought it would be. Thought it would be a disposable one and done type deal--but is quality enough I'll be able to reuse it several more times for sure. Easy to assemble. Held up during moderate rain storm and winds for our event. Use the attached ties to help secure and provide stability.
customer_reviews.author: M&M

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Takes 2 people about 30 minutes to set up. Has always worked wonderfully no matter what family function we use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a party
customer_reviews.text: I am incredibly happy with this tent. The top is very sturdy. The tent legs don't latch together, but the white tape that comes with the tent worked wonderfully. It was perfect for my daughter's graduation party and I'll be able to use it again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Put this product together. Very easy to do. However product isnpoorly made. Was not able to handle the wind and the had some freezing rain the 2nd day and the little bit of weight on it caused the whole thing to collapse. Poles are made of very thin aluminum. Price looked really good, but to good to be true.
customer_reviews.author: Tim K

customer_reviews.title: Those locking pin needs more improvements.
customer_reviews.text: The upper tube are eases to disconnect in just a milder winds. The locking pin doesn't have enough grief, it's come out so easy. Doesn't hold good!
customer_reviews.author: Manuel JIMENEZ

product_meta.title: Quictent 10'x20' Party Tent Gazebo Wedding Canopy with Removable Sidewalls & Elegant Church
feature_bullets: ✅【WARRANTY】1. Lifetime Free Replacement for Connectors, Pegs, Ropes, Elastic ropes, etc. 2. 6 months Free Warranty for Covers and Poles. 3. Lifetime Free Replacement for a few natural-loss poles. 4. Lifetime 50% OFF Parts Supply exceed normal 6-month warranty.
✅【Heavy Duty White Powder Coated Tube】32mm (Dia) Heavy Duty Rust Resistant steel framework makes this canopy more durable.
✅【Extra-thick Polyethylene Fabric】Reinforced PE material is Tear-proof, Waterproof and Anti-UV. Industrial grade Cover Fabric for long lasting durability and protection guaranteed.
✅【Reinforcement Accessaries】With Plastic rings, Pegs ,Connector joints and Ropes, Making the carport more stable and easy to connect the poles and cover

✅【MULTIPLE USAGE】The party tent is perfect for your wedding, party, baby shower and so on. And you can also use this tent for backyard barbecue with your friends, or the canopy tent is the best choice for your birthday party as well.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars996 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
